name: irreproachably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is without fault and therefore impossible to criticize: For one hundred years the Central Bank had remained irreproachably above politics. Not all the soldiers behaved irreproachably.
More examplesFewer examplesHe did not enjoy social occasions, though he was irreproachably welcoming to visitors.He has only ever lived an irreproachably modest and serious life.He not only plays extremely well but behaves irreproachably when off the court.I think in our household we are irreproachably sparing in our water consumption.
